title: How are you able to write so well? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, I think I’ve got decent skills, but nothing that’d be a New York Times Best-seller. I took time by simply writing my own stories. When I was in 4th grade, I began taking an interest in reading and writing stories. I would read books and I’d study how the quotations worked in the sentences. To be honest, that’s how I learned how to place quotes in sentences. I would scrutinize each sentence, write it down, then I’d replace some of the words in it with my own. Oh, and let’s not forget I had the basic required English classes as well. My advice is to just read books to enrich your grammatical and vocabulary skills. If you’ve got time to spare, you can always take notes on a novel you’re reading. Examine the sentence structure and punctuation. Once you start writing on your own, you’ll begin to get better. Practice makes perfect.

Practice! Reading! Research! Trial and error! One of the best things I can ever recommend anyone who wants to get better at writing is to RE-WRITE YOUR WORK. As someone who learned and is still learning, rewriting can do wonders for your draft. I don’t know what the magic is, but when you write something down and rewrite it later, it gets a whole lot better. Another thing is: DON’T STOP. I know it’ll get discouraging. I know it’ll look like gosh, if those fan fiction writers can do it better than me, why am I even doing this? And i can guarantee that the longer you keep at it, the lovelier your work will become. And be open to criticism! If someone says they don’t particularly like your work, ask them why. If their answer is “I dunno,” ignore them and keep on moving. But if their answer is something useful, take it!
I don’t try to write, it just pours out, and i write it down.
